drupalNodeEvent.title: The Chinese Economy: New Policies, Challenges and Directions

field_speakers.processed: Professor Xu Qiyuan (Chinese Academy of Social Sciences), Professor Zhuang Rui (University of International Business and Economics, Beijing), Professor David Dollar (John L Thornton China Centre, Brookings Institution)

field_organizers.processed: New Zealand Contemporary China Research Centre, Victoria University of Wellington

field_description.processed:
2020 has been a challenging year for economic policymakers all over the world. China is faced with managing the ongoing structural transformation of the economy, the fallout from the US-China Trade War and the global economic slowdown brought on by the COVID-19 pandemic. Join us for three talks on how Chinese planners are responding to these challenges through new policies, priorities and economic directions.
Talk Titles:
- 'Dual Circulation: China’s New Economic Policy Framework Amidst U.S.—China Tensions' Time: 4.00-5.00pm, [Tuesday 17 November (NZT)]
- 'Chinese Foreign Trade Policy' [Time: 4.00-5.00pm, Wednesday 18 November (NZT)]
- 'Challenges for the Chinese Economy in Light of the Global Recession and Trade War' Time: 10.00-11.00am, [Thursday 19 November (NZT)]
